name: bissara with onions
ingredients: 300 g of split peas (or dried fava beans)
For garnish: Olive oil, Cumin, Paprika (or Harissa)
steps: In a pressure cooker (or a pot), saut√© the split peas, garlic cloves, salt, and cumin in olive oil for 3 minutes.
Add the water. Close the pressure cooker and cook under pressure for 20 minutes (for split peas) or until the legumes are very tender (longer for fava beans/chickpeas).
Blend everything using an immersion blender until you get a creamy velvety texture (you can add boiling water if you want a more liquid consistency).
Serve in bowls. Season with a drizzle of olive oil, a pinch of cumin, and paprika (or Harissa, not specified in the title but common for the variation). Enjoy immediately with homemade bread.
